column4: how would i fix the bootloader after (unfortunately) installing vista on a partition?
grub2?
yes. would the ubuntu cd be able to just restore the bootloader without actually writing to a new partition?
yes which cd and install do you have?
well, right now i have 4.10, but i'll probably just burn a more recent one ;)
how did you install the linux and what is it=release?
freebsd is multi disks
one dvd though
you might turn off the md5 in plugins
isn't there a boot disc besides a dvd.
i don't mind that it checksums, but why two different burning cycles?
... what... fml
the freebsd site says "The FreeBSD CDROM and DVD images are bootable and can be used to install FreeBSD without any other special preparation." Wouldn't this imply that the main dvd is bootable?
yes you are correct the dvd can do it all, as far as the install, check the md5 of that ISO.

the ways i found online of checking the md5 of a disk have never returned the same md5 as the iso i burned, but the md5s they return is consistent across different disks. any suggestions on how to check the disk?
when I actually check I use this link. https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HowToMD5SUM
uh... i can't even read the dvd from ubuntu at this point... i put it back in the drive (brasero ejected it) and now it's doing cyclical 5 second spin ups and then stopping
I have seen that happen, I use a couple of apps in this area, generally another works.
also note that a burned ISO has to be checked differently then the ISO
yep. i noticed that
the way i was doing it before was copying the disk to /tmp/something.iso and then md5ing the iso
but now i'll try "dd if=/dev/dvdrw bs=1 count=810356736 | md5sum" if it ever lets me
restarting for a sec
